messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
I can help pinpoint your current location, but I’ll need access to your device’s location services (GPS) first. Would you like me to turn on location services and find your location?

Great! To pinpoint your location accurately I’ll need your device’s latitude and longitude coordinates. Could you please share those (or let me know if your device can display them so you can pass them along)?

I don’t have a way to pull your coordinates directly from your phone—your device has to tell me its latitude and longitude, or you have to provide an address or other information I can look up.  

Here are a few options:

1. On most phones you can copy your GPS coordinates:
   • iOS: Open the “Compass” or “Maps” app, then look for the numbers at the bottom (or long-press the blue dot and choose “Share”).  
   • Android/Google Maps: Tap and hold on the blue “you are here” dot until a pin drops; the coordinates appear in the search bar and can be copied.

2. If you can’t get coordinates, tell me the closest street address, intersection, or landmark, and I can figure out where that is.

Let me know which of these works for you, or if you’d like more step-by-step help to get the coordinates.
Could you use the tools you've got to figure it out?

I wish I could pull your coordinates directly, but the tools I have can only look up a location once I know either:

• Your latitude/longitude coordinates, or  
• A nearby street address, intersection, or landmark.

Unfortunately there’s no tool here that lets me query your phone’s GPS on my own—your device (or you) has to supply that basic clue first. If you can give me any of that information, I can instantly translate it into an exact location for you.
